result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian S Davis

records.addlTxt: Br 4 clerk rec'd call from def's wife, def. is currently in-custody in Winnebago, IL.  Informed her that the def. needs to contact his Pub Def.

09:02 AM
Defendant, Brian S Davis, appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp.
Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant, Brian S Davis, appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

128PM    Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am..   Bond continued posted with same conditions as previously set (see previous bond entry). rb

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
